name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

name: $addidentifier
desc: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

name: $basedOn
desc: Returns: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

name: $addbasedOn
desc: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

name: $partOf
desc: Returns: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

name: $addpartOf
desc: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The status of the result value.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The status of the result value.

name: $category
desc: Returns: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

name: $addcategory
desc: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

name: $code
desc: Returns: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

name: $subject
desc: Returns: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `focus` element or the `code` itself specifies the actual focus of the observation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `f

name: $focus
desc: Returns: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

name: $addfocus
desc: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observa

name: $encounter
desc: Returns: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

name: $issued
desc: Returns: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

name: $performer
desc: Returns: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

name: $addperformer
desc: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

name: $dataAbsentReason
desc: Returns: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

name: $interpretation
desc: Returns: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

name: $addinterpretation
desc: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

name: $note
desc: Returns: Comments about the observation or the results.

name: $addnote
desc: Comments about the observation or the results.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Comments about the observation or the results.

name: $bodySite
desc: Returns: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

name: $method
desc: Returns: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

name: $specimen
desc: Returns: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

name: $device
desc: Returns: The device used to generate the observation data.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The device used to generate the observation data.

name: $referenceRange
desc: Returns: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

name: $addreferenceRange
desc: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

name: $hasMember
desc: Returns: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

name: $addhasMember
desc: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

name: $derivedFrom
desc: Returns: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

name: $addderivedFrom
desc: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

name: $component
desc: Returns: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

name: $addcomponent
desc: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement
